intro: Tripleurospermum perforatum, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are linear and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments.
